metadata.name: Description
metadata.value: SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.SENIOR MANAGER SOFTWARE ENGINEERING (STARLINK E-COMMERCE PLATFORM)At SpaceX we’re leveraging our experience in building rockets and spacecraft to deploy Starlink, the world’s most advanced broadband internet system. Starlink is the world’s largest satellite constellation and is providing fast, reliable internet to nearly 2M users worldwide. We design, build, test, and operate all parts of the system – thousands of satellites, consumer receivers that allow users to connect within minutes of unboxing, and the software that glues the system together, and the customer facing experiences that allow us to sell our service global. We’ve only begun to scratch the surface of Starlink’s potential global impact and are looking for best-in-class engineers to help us deliver an e-commerce platform that will allow us to bring Starlink around the world.As Senior Software Manager of the Consumer Platform team, you’d be managing a team of 20+ engineers distributed across Redmond, WA, Hawthorne, CA, and Sunnyvale, CA working on building Starlink’s global e-commerce platform. You’ll be responsible for a highly scalable web platform that facilitates payments, fulfillment, customer support, enterprise sales, as well as the customer-facing experience using our service. You will work closely with a mix of both external customers and internal partners across many disciplines to enable global growth and define the strategy of the Starlink business. We’re looking for someone who’s able to write code and drive good architectural decisions to make the greatest internet service provider in the world.RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage a team of software engineers that are responsible for execution across multiple disciplines and subsystemsProvide strong technical leadership with a focus on excellence and executionManage overall product roadmap, including the development of the global e-commerce platform that runs the Starlink businessDrive all aspects of the program, including architecture, development, and deliveryHire and mentor software engineers and leaders to build a strong team that can deliver results on scheduleBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, math, or other STEM disciplines.4+ years of experience in software engineering.2+ years of software engineering management experience overseeing a team of software engineers.PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Hands-on experience developing in C#, Angular, and/or Typescript3+ years of engineering management experience.5+ years of experience in developing and delivering robust and scalable software applications.Hands-on experience building an e-commerce platform and collecting payments globally.Excellent mentorship, communication, and teamwork skillsADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:Must be willing to travel (approximately ~20% of the time) domestically and internationally in the future when needed.Must be available to work extended hours and weekends if needed to meet critical deadlines COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:Pay range:          Senior Manager, Software Engineering: $210,000.00 - $270,000.00/per year                                       Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation and will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.                        ITAR REQUIREMENTS:To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

title: Sr. Manager Software Engineering (Starlink E-Commerce Platform)
content:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.
SR. MANAGER SOFTWARE ENGINEERING (STARLINK E-COMMERCE PLATFORM)
At SpaceX we’re leveraging our experience in building rockets and spacecraft to deploy Starlink, the world’s most advanced broadband internet system. Starlink is the world’s largest satellite constellation and is providing fast, reliable internet to nearly 2M users worldwide. We design, build, test, and operate all parts of the system – thousands of satellites, consumer receivers that allow users to connect within minutes of unboxing, and the software that glues the system together, and the customer facing experiences that allow us to sell our service global. We’ve only begun to scratch the surface of Starlink’s potential global impact and are looking for best-in-class engineers to help us deliver an e-commerce platform that will allow us to bring Starlink around the world.
As Senior Software Manager of the Consumer Platform team, you’d be managing a team of 20+ engineers distributed across Redmond, WA, Hawthorne, CA, and Sunnyvale, CA working on building Starlink’s global e-commerce platform. You’ll be responsible for a highly scalable web platform that facilitates payments, fulfillment, customer support, enterprise sales, as well as the customer-facing experience using our service. You will work closely with a mix of both external customers and internal partners across many disciplines to enable global growth and define the strategy of the Starlink business. We’re looking for someone who’s able to write code and drive good architectural decisions to make the greatest internet service provider in the world.
RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Manage a team of software engineers that are responsible for execution across multiple disciplines and subsystems
Provide strong technical leadership with a focus on excellence and execution
Manage overall product roadmap, including the development of the global e-commerce platform that runs the Starlink business
Drive all aspects of the program, including architecture, development, and delivery
Hire and mentor software engineers and leaders to build a strong team that can deliver results on schedule

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, math, or other STEM disciplines and 4+ years of experience in software engineering; OR 10+ years of professional experience in software development in lieu of a degree
2+ years of software engineering management experience overseeing a team of software engineers

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Hands-on experience developing in C#, Angular, and/or Typescript
3+ years of engineering management experience.
5+ years of experience in developing and delivering robust and scalable software applications.
Hands-on experience building an e-commerce platform and collecting payments globally.
Excellent mentorship, communication, and teamwork skills

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be willing to travel (approximately ~20% of the time) domestically and internationally in the future when needed.
Must be available to work extended hours and weekends if needed to meet critical deadlines 

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
Pay range:          
Senior Manager, Software Engineering: $210,000.00 - $270,000.00/per year        
Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.
Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation and will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.        
ITAR REQUIREMENTS:

To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.  

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.description: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here.
